comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Nona Hazelhurst McAdoo (1892 or 1893-1971) was the daughter of Senator William G. McAdoo. Her stepmother Eleanor Wilson was the daughter of President Woodrow Wilson. wc.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=REG&db=wo... She married four times: "in 1917 to Ferdinand de Mohrenschildt, one-time official of the Russian Embassy in Washington, who died in 1919. In 1928 Mrs. de Mohrenschildt was married in this city to Dr. Edward S. Cowles, psychiatrist and founder of the Body-and-Soul Clinic at St. Mark's-in-the-Bouwerie, who was the object of a protest of the authorities of the Protestant Episcopal Church for his use of the church for healing clinics." She divorced Edward Spencer Cowles (note spelling). In 1935, she married Francis Taylor, but they too divorced, in 1939. Her last husband was Darragh A. Park. wc.rootsweb.ancestry.com/cgi-bin/igm.cgi?op=GET&db=wo... homepages.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~asbellm/genealogy/fam042... This photo must have been labeled long after 1915, if the subject is indeed Nona Hazelhurst McAdoo de Mohrenschildt Cowles (Taylor)(Park).

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The negative bears 1915 and 1927 dates (rootsweb cite says elsewhere Cowles marriage was 8/13/27), so the Bain labelers must have have expanded her name as she added husbands. She seems to have been buried in the same plot with her first and last husbands, as well as her mother. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=63959244

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: True!  You can almost see the name grow in the handwritten caption--started out as "Nona McAdoo" (that part is bigger, brighter, and centered over the image), then the first husband's long surname was added, then that whole segment was parenthesized and "Mrs. E. S. Coles" was squeezed into the remaining space.  No wonder they spelled Cowles wrong in all that... ;)

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks pennylrichardsca and artolog for tracking this woman through her name changes. I agree that it looks as though Bain just kept using the same old photo of her squeezing in her married names.  We'll make some corrections to spelling and add the earlier date to the record the next time we update.
